newsitem.title: USA: N.J. Steel CEO Kenneth Leonared resigns.
newsitem.headline: N.J. Steel CEO Kenneth Leonared resigns.

text.p: New Jersey Steel Corp said Friday that by mutual agreement chief executive and president Kenneth Leonard has resigned, effective immediately.
Gary Giovannetti, vice-president of sales and marketing was named to succeed him.

The company said that Von Roll Holding Ltd, its majority shareholder, has been dissatisfied with the company's operating results, which have shown losses for its most recent fiscal quarters. Additional, though reduced, losses are expected for the first quarter of fiscal 1997, it said.
The company said that it is confident that Giovanetti will restore the company to profitability later this year.
